00032 
00033 template <typename T, int Size>
00034 BList<T, Size>::BList(){
00035   // initialize head and tail
00036   head_ = 0;
00037   tail_ = 0;
00038   // construct the stats
00039   stats = BListStats();
00040   // set the array size using the int paramater
00041   stats.ArraySize = Size;
00042   // and the nodesize by using the size of the template parameter * size
00043   stats.NodeSize = Size * sizeof(T);
00044 }

00046 /*****************************************************************************/
00057 /*****************************************************************************/
00058 
00059 template <typename T, int Size>
00060 BList<T, Size>::BList(const BList &rhs){
00061   // reset the list, because it will be getting all its new elements from rhs
00062   head_ = 0;
00063   tail_ = 0;
00064   
00065   // start the copy at the head
00066   BNode* tocopy = rhs.head_;
00067   
00068   // copy over the stats from the rhs
00069   stats.NodeSize = rhs.stats.NodeSize;
00070   stats.ArraySize = rhs.stats.ArraySize;
00071 
00072   // copy over the head
00073   if (!head_)
00074     head_ = copy_node(tocopy);
00075   // and at this point the head is also tail, because there is only one node
00076   if (!tail_)
00077     tail_ = head_;
00078 
00079   // prepare to copy the next node from rhs
00080   tocopy = tocopy->next;
00081 
00082   // copy over all nodes in rhs, until tocopy points at null
00083   while (tocopy){
00084     // make a copy of the current node in rhs
00085     BNode* copy = copy_node(tocopy);
00086 
00087     // and add the node to the end of the list, using tail pointer
00088     tail_->next = copy;
00089     copy->prev = tail_;
00090 
00091     // update the tail pointer
00092     tail_ = copy;
00093 
00094     // move to the next node in rhs
00095     tocopy = tocopy->next;
00096   }
00097 
00098 }

00113 BList<T, Size>::~BList() NOEXCEPT(true){
00114   // delete all the data for the BList
00115   clear();
00116 }

00133 /*****************************************************************************/
00134 
00135 template <typename T, int Size>
00136 BList<T, Size>& BList<T, Size>::operator=(const BList<T, Size> &rhs) NOEXCEPT(false){
00137   // initialize the node to copy to the head of rhs
00138   BNode* tocopy = rhs.head_;
00139   
00140   // check for self-assignment 
00141   if (this == &rhs)
00142     return *this;
00143 
00144   // clear the list that will be assigned to
00145   clear();
00146 
00147   // assign the stats of rhs to this list
00148   BListStats(rhs.stats.NodeSize, rhs.stats.NodeCount, rhs.stats.ArraySize, 
00149              rhs.stats.ItemCount);
00150 
00151   // copy the head node from rhs into this
00152   if (!head_)
00153     head_ = copy_node(tocopy);
00154   // and because there is only one node, the tail is also the head
00155   if (!tail_)
00156     tail_ = head_;
00157 
00158   // increment rhs to the next node
00159   tocopy = tocopy->next;
00160 
00161   // copy over all nodes in rhs
00162   while (tocopy){
00163     // make a copy of the current node in rhs
00164     BNode* copy = copy_node(tocopy);
00165 
00166     // use the tail pointer to add it to end of this
00167     tail_->next = copy;
00168     // and update the prev pointer of the copied node to the old tail
00169     copy->prev = tail_;
00170 
00171     // update the tail pointer to the new node
00172     tail_ = copy;
00173 
00174     // look at the next node in rhs
00175     tocopy = tocopy->next;
00176   }
00177 
00178    // return the updated list
00179    return *this;
00180 }

00196 
00197 template <typename T, int Size>
00198 void BList<T, Size>::push_back(const T& value) NOEXCEPT(false){
00199   // make a copy of the tail of the list 
00200   BNode* oldtail = tail_;
00201   
00202   // if there is no tail (the list is empty)
00203   if (!tail_)
00204   {
00205     // then make a new node with the provided value
00206     BNode* newtail = new_node(value);
00207     // and assign it to the tail
00208     tail_ = newtail;
00209   }
00210   else
00211   {
00212     // otherwise, insert it after or into the tail node, with value
00213     insert_after(oldtail, value);
00214   }
00215   
00216   // if there is no head (the list was empty) then the tail is also the head
00217   if (!head_)
00218     head_ = tail_;
00219 }

00234 /*****************************************************************************/
00235 
00236 template <typename T, int Size>
00237 void BList<T, Size>::push_front(const T& value) NOEXCEPT(false){
00238   // make a copy of the old head of the list
00239   BNode* oldhead = head_;
00240 
00241   // if there is no head (the list is empty)
00242   if (!head_)
00243   {
00244     // then make a new node with value
00245     BNode* newhead = new_node(value);
00246     // and assign it to the head
00247     head_ = newhead;
00248   }
00249   else
00250   {
00251     // shift values over to make room for new value at front
00252     insert_before(oldhead, value);
00253   }
00254 
00255   // if there is no tail (the list was empty) then the tail is also the head
00256   if (!tail_)
00257     tail_ = head_; 
00258 }

00260 /*****************************************************************************/
00273 /*****************************************************************************/
00274 
00275 template <typename T, int Size>
00276 void BList<T, Size>::insert(const T& value) NOEXCEPT(false){
00277 
00278   //if the list is empty just push the new value into a new node as head
00279   if (!head_)
00280   {
00281     push_front(value);
00282     return;
00283   }
00284   //if the value is smaller than the value in the head node
00285   if (value < head_->values[0])
00286   {
00287     // and if the array size is 1, or the head is full
00288     if (stats.ArraySize == 1 || !full(head_))
00289     {
00290       // then just push the value into a new node as the head
00291       push_front(value);
00292       return;
00293     }
00294     else
00295     {
00296       // otherwise, try to put the node into the head node
00297       split_node(head_, value);
00298     }
00299   }
00300   //if the value is larger than the value in the last element
00301   //and the tail is not full, then push back
00302   if (tail_->values[tail_->count - 1] < value && !full(tail_))
00303   {
00304     push_back(value);
00305     return;
00306   }
00307 
00308   // otherwise, we have to loop over the list, looking for the node that the value
00309   // fits into, so create a copy of the head
00310   BNode * currentnode = head_;
00311 
00312   // loop over the list
00313   while (currentnode)
00314   {
00315     // if there is a next node
00316     if (currentnode->next)
00317     {
00318       // then make a copy of it
00319       BNode* nextnode = currentnode->next;
00320 
00321       //if the first value in the next node is bigger
00322       //then must place in the currentnode
00323       if (value < nextnode->values[0])
00324       {
00325         // so if the current node is not full
00326         if (!full(currentnode))
00327         {
00328           // then insert the value into the current node
00329           insert_into(currentnode, value);
00330           return;
00331         }
00332         // otherwise, the current node is full
00333         else
00334         {
00335           // so if the number of elements in each node is more than one
00336           if (stats.ArraySize > 1)
00337           {
00338             // then if the next node is not full, and the value is more than
00339             // the max element of the current node
00340             if (!full(nextnode) && 
00341                 currentnode->values[currentnode->count - 1] < value)
00342             {
00343               // then insert the value into the next node
00344               insert_into(nextnode, value);
00345               return;
00346             }
00347             // otherwise, split the current node and put the value in one of the halves
00348             else
00349             {
00350               split_node(currentnode, value);
00351               return;
00352             }
00353           }
00354           // otherwise, each node only has one element,
00355           else
00356           {
00357             // so insert the value before the next node
00358             insert_before(nextnode, value);
00359             return;
00360           }
00361         }
00362       }
00363     }
00364     //if there is no next node
00365     else
00366     {
00367       // then if the current node isn't full,
00368       if (!full(currentnode))
00369       {
00370         // put the value into the current node
00371         insert_into(currentnode, value);
00372         return;
00373       }
00374       // if the current node is full
00375       else
00376       {
00377         // then if there are more than one element in each node
00378         if (stats.ArraySize > 1)
00379         {
00380           // split the current node, and put the value in one of the halves
00381           split_node(currentnode, value);
00382           return;
00383         }
00384         // otherwise, there is more than one element in each node
00385         else
00386         {
00387           // so we can insert after the current node
00388           insert_after(currentnode, value);
00389           return;
00390         }
00391       }
00392     }
00393     // keep looking through the nodes
00394     currentnode = currentnode->next;
00395   }
00396 }

00398 /*****************************************************************************/
00411 /*****************************************************************************/
00412 
00413 template <typename T, int Size>
00414 void BList<T, Size>::remove(int index) NOEXCEPT(false){
00415   // make copy of head node, for looping over list
00416   BNode* currentnode = head_;
00417   // count of items looked at to 0
00418   int count = 0;
00419 
00420   // loop over the list
00421   while (currentnode)
00422   {
00423     // and over the items in the node
00424     for (int i = 0; i < currentnode->count; ++i)
00425     {
00426         // if the element in node is at the index
00427         if (count == index)
00428         {
00429           // and the current node only has this element
00430           if (currentnode->count == 1)
00431           {
00432             // then if the current node is the head
00433             if (currentnode == head_)
00434               // the new head is the next node
00435               head_ = currentnode->next;
00436             // and if the current node is the tail
00437             if (currentnode == tail_)
00438               // the new tail is the previous node
00439               tail_ = currentnode->prev;
00440             // now remove the node with the element at index
00441             remove_node(currentnode);
00442             return;
00443           }
00444           // otherwise, the current node has more than one element
00445           else
00446           {
00447             // so overwrite the element by shifting over the others
00448             for (int j = i; j < currentnode->count - 1; ++j)
00449               currentnode->values[j] = currentnode->values[j + 1];
00450             // and update the item count for the list
00451             stats.ItemCount--;
00452             // and for the node
00453             currentnode->count--;
00454           }
00455         }
00456         // keep looking for the index
00457         ++count;
00458     }
00459     // keep looking in the nodes
00460     currentnode = currentnode->next;
00461   }
00462 }

00464 /*****************************************************************************/
00475 /*****************************************************************************/
00476 
00477 template <typename T, int Size>
00478 void BList<T, Size>::remove_by_value(const T& value){
00479   // temp copy of head, to iterate
00480   BNode* currentnode = head_;
00481 
00482   // loop over the list
00483   while (currentnode){
00484     // loop over the items in the node
00485     for (int i = 0; i < currentnode->count; ++i)
00486     {
00487       // if the current element in current node has the value
00488       if (currentnode->values[i] == value)
00489       { 
00490         // then if the node only has this element
00491         if (currentnode->count == 1)
00492         {
00493           // check if it is the head
00494           if (currentnode == head_)
00495             // if so, the next node will be the new head
00496             head_ = currentnode->next;
00497           // check if it is the tail
00498           if (currentnode == tail_)
00499             // then the previous node will be the new tail
00500             tail_ = currentnode->prev;
00501           // now remove this node, because it has the value
00502           remove_node(currentnode);
00503           // and end
00504           return;
00505         }
00506         // if the current node has more than one element
00507         else
00508         {
00509           // then overwrite this element by shifting the other elements on top of it
00510           for (int j = i; j < currentnode->count - 1; ++j)
00511             currentnode->values[j] = currentnode->values[j + 1];
00512           // then decrement item count for the list
00513           stats.ItemCount--;
00514           // and for the node
00515           currentnode->count--;
00516         }
00517       }
00518     }
00519     // keep looking through nodes
00520     currentnode = currentnode->next;
00521   }
00522 
00523 }

00525 /*****************************************************************************/
00538 /*****************************************************************************/
00539 
00540 template <typename T, int Size>
00541 int BList<T, Size>::find(const T& value) const{
00542   // make a copy of the head node, so we can iterate over the list
00543   BNode* currentnode = head_;
00544   // start count at 0, to be updated to the index of the node with value
00545   int count = 0;
00546 
00547   // loop over the list
00548   while (currentnode){
00549     // loop over items in node
00550     for (int i = 0; i < currentnode->count; ++i)
00551     {
00552       // if the current item in current node has the value
00553       if (currentnode->values[i] == value)
00554         // then return current count
00555         return count;
00556       else
00557         // otherwise, increment count and keep looking
00558         ++count;
00559     }
00560     // if the value wasn't in this node, look in the next one
00561     currentnode = currentnode->next;
00562   }
00563   // if the value wasn't found, return -1
00564   return -1;
00565 }

00567 /*****************************************************************************/
00582 /*****************************************************************************/
00583 
00584 template <typename T, int Size>
00585 T& BList<T, Size>::operator[](int index) NOEXCEPT(false){
00586   // make a copy of the head node, so we can iterate over the list
00587   BNode* currentnode = head_;
00588   // count of items looked at starts at 0
00589   int count = 0;
00590   // arrayindex to save where we found the index starts at 0
00591   int arrayindex = 0;
00592   // a flag to determine when we've found the index
00593   bool found = 0;
00594   // try to find the index
00595   try
00596   {
00597     // by looping over the list until it points at null
00598     while (currentnode)
00599     {
00600       // and looping over all the items in each node
00601       for (int i = 0; i < currentnode->count; ++i)
00602       {
00603         // if the count of items looked at is the index
00604         if (count == index)
00605         {
00606           // then we have found the index
00607           found = 1;
00608           // and it is at i, the element in the current node
00609           arrayindex = i;
00610           // so break
00611           break;
00612         }
00613         // otherwise, increment count and keep looking through the list
00614         ++count;
00615       }
00616       // if the index was found, then end the loop
00617       if (found)
00618         break;
00619       // otherwise, look at the next node
00620       currentnode = currentnode->next;
00621     }
00622   }
00623   // if the index wasn't found, it is a bad one, so throw an exception
00624   catch (const std::exception)
00625   {
00626     throw(BListException(BListException::E_BAD_INDEX, 
00627       "const operator[]: Bad index."));
00628   }
00629   
00630   // return the value at index
00631   return currentnode->values[arrayindex];
00632 }

00651 template <typename T, int Size>
00652 const T& BList<T, Size>::operator[](int index) const NOEXCEPT(false){
00653   // make a copy of the head node, so we can iterate over the list
00654   BNode* currentnode = head_;
00655   // count of items looked at starts at 0
00656   int count = 0;
00657   // arrayindex to save where we found the index starts at 0
00658   int arrayindex = 0;
00659   // a flag to determine when we've found the index
00660   bool found = 0;
00661   // try to find the index
00662   try
00663   {
00664     // by looping over the list until it points at null
00665     while (currentnode)
00666     {
00667       // and looping over all the items in each node
00668       for (int i = 0; i < currentnode->count; ++i)
00669       {
00670         // if the count of items looked at is the index
00671         if (count == index)
00672         {
00673           // then we have found the index
00674           found = 1;
00675           // and it is at i, the element in the current node
00676           arrayindex = i;
00677           // so break
00678           break;
00679         }
00680         // otherwise, increment count and keep looking through the list
00681         ++count;
00682       }
00683       // if the index was found, then end the loop
00684       if (found)
00685         break;
00686       // otherwise, look at the next node
00687       currentnode = currentnode->next;
00688     }
00689   }
00690   // if the index wasn't found, it is a bad one, so throw an exception
00691   catch (const std::exception)
00692   {
00693     throw(BListException(BListException::E_BAD_INDEX, 
00694       "const operator[]: Bad index."));
00695   }
00696   
00697   // return the value at index
00698   return currentnode->values[arrayindex];

00733 void BList<T, Size>::clear(void){
00734   while(!empty()){
00735     pop_front();
00736   }

00798 /*****************************************************************************/
00809 /*****************************************************************************/
00810 
00811 template <typename T, int Size>
00812 void BList<T,Size>::pop_front(void){
00813   // if there is a head (the list is not empty)
00814   if (head_)
00815   {
00816     // then make a copy of the head
00817     BNode* nodetodel = head_;
00818 
00819     // unlink the old head
00820     head_ = head_->next;
00821     
00822     // decrement the item count by the number of items in the node to delete
00823     stats.ItemCount -= nodetodel->count;
00824     // decrement the node count for the list
00825     stats.NodeCount--;
00826     // and delete the node
00827     delete nodetodel;
00828   }
00829   
00830   // otherwise, the list is empty, so just return
00831   else return;
00832 }
00833

00846 /*****************************************************************************/
00847 
00848 template <typename T, int Size>
00849 bool BList<T, Size>::empty(void){
00850   if (!head_)
00851     return true;
00852   else
00853     return false;
00854 }

00857 /*****************************************************************************/
00869 /*****************************************************************************/
00870 
00871 template <typename T, int Size>
00872 typename BList<T, Size>::BNode* BList<T, Size>::new_node(const T& value){
00873   // try to make a new node
00874   BNode* node = 0;
00875   try
00876   {
00877     node = new BNode; 
00878   }
00879   // throw out of memory if it fails
00880   catch (const std::exception)
00881   {
00882     throw(BListException(BListException::E_NO_MEMORY, 
00883       "new_node: Out of memory."));
00884   }
00885   
00886   // set the value in the first element of the node to the provided one
00887   node->values[0] = value;
00888   // increment the node count and item count for the list
00889   stats.NodeCount++;
00890   stats.ItemCount++;
00891   // increment the item count for the node
00892   node->count++;
00893   // return the new node
00894   return node;
00895 }
00896 
00897 /*****************************************************************************/
00909 /*****************************************************************************/
00910 
00911 template <typename T, int Size>
00912 void BList<T, Size>::remove_node(BNode* todelete){
00913   // make copies of the node before
00914   BNode* todeleteprev = todelete->prev;
00915   // and the node after the node to be deleted
00916   BNode* nextnode = todelete->next;
00917   
00918   // then unlink the node, check if there is a node before it
00919   if (todeleteprev)
00920     // then the node before it now points to the node after it
00921     todeleteprev->next = nextnode;
00922   // if there was a node after it
00923   if (nextnode)
00924     // then the node after it now points to the node before it
00925     nextnode->prev = todeleteprev;
00926 
00927   // decrement number of nodes in the list
00928   stats.NodeCount--;
00929   // and number of items in the list, by subtracting number of items in the node
00930   stats.ItemCount -= todelete->count;
00931   // then delete the node
00932   delete todelete;
00933 }
00934 
00935 /*****************************************************************************/
00949 /*****************************************************************************/
00950 
00951 template <typename T, int Size>
00952 bool BList<T, Size>::full(BNode* isfull){
00953   if (isfull->count == stats.ArraySize)
00954     return true;
00955   else
00956     return false;
00957 }
00958 
00959 /*****************************************************************************/
00972 /*****************************************************************************/
00973 
00974 template <typename T, int Size>
00975 void BList<T, Size>::insert_after(BNode* insertafter, const T& value){
00976   // if the node to insert in is full
00977   if (full(insertafter))
00978   {
00979     // then make a copy of the next node
00980     BNode* nextnode = insertafter->next;
00981     // make a new node with the provided value
00982     BNode* toinsert = new_node(value);
00983     // and link the new node with the node that we tried to insert into
00984     insertafter->next = toinsert;
00985     toinsert->prev = insertafter;
00986     // if there is a next node
00987     if (nextnode)
00988     {
00989       // then link the new node with this one as well
00990       toinsert->next = nextnode;
00991       nextnode->prev = toinsert;
00992     }
00993     // if the node we tried to insert into was the tail
00994     if (insertafter == tail_)
00995       // then the node we created is the new tail
00996       tail_ = toinsert;
00997   }
00998   // if the node to insert in is not full
00999   else
01000   {
01001     // then insert the value at the unused element in the node
01002     insertafter->values[insertafter->count] = value;
01003     // increment the item count for the list
01004     stats.ItemCount++;
01005     // and for the node
01006     insertafter->count++;
01007   }
01008 }
01009 
01010 
01011 /*****************************************************************************/
01026 /*****************************************************************************/
01027 
01028 template <typename T, int Size>
01029 void BList<T, Size>::split_node(BNode* tosplit, const T& value){
01030   // create a new node for the first part of the split, with the first value
01031   // from the node to be split
01032   BNode* firstnew = new_node(tosplit->values[0]);
01033   // and another new node with the last value from the node to be split
01034   BNode* secondnew = new_node(tosplit->values[(stats.ArraySize/2)]);
01035 
01036   // update the new nodes with half of the split node's values each
01037   for (int i = 1; i < stats.ArraySize / 2; ++i)
01038   {
01039     firstnew->values[i] = tosplit->values[i];
01040     stats.ItemCount++;
01041     firstnew->count++;
01042   }
01043   for (int i = 1; i < (stats.ArraySize / 2); ++i)
01044   {
01045     secondnew->values[i] = tosplit->values[i + (stats.ArraySize / 2)];
01046     stats.ItemCount++;
01047     secondnew->count++;
01048   }
01049 
01050   // after the nodes have been updated with half of the values each,
01051   // determine where to put the provided value
01052 
01053   //if the value is less than the first element of the second half
01054   if (value < secondnew->values[0])
01055     // then put the value in the first half
01056     insert_into(firstnew, value);
01057   else
01058     // otherwise, put it in the second half
01059     insert_into(secondnew, value);
01060 
01061   // link the two nodes together
01062   firstnew->next = secondnew;
01063   secondnew->prev = firstnew;
01064 
01065   // save the nodes before and after the split node, for linking
01066   BNode* tosplitprev = tosplit->prev;
01067   BNode* tosplitnext = tosplit->next;
01068 
01069   // link the new nodes into the list
01070   if (tosplitprev)
01071     tosplitprev->next = firstnew;
01072   firstnew->prev = tosplitprev;
01073   secondnew->next = tosplitnext;
01074   if (tosplitnext)
01075     tosplitnext->prev = secondnew;
01076 
01077   // if the node to be split was the head
01078   if (tosplit == head_)
01079     // then the first half is the new head
01080     head_ = firstnew;
01081 
01082   // if the node to be split was the tail
01083   if (tosplit == tail_)
01084     // then the second half is the new tail
01085     tail_ = secondnew;
01086 
01087   // decrment the node count for the list
01088   stats.NodeCount--;
01089   // and subtract the item count of the node split node from the item count for the list
01090   stats.ItemCount -= tosplit->count;
01091   // then delete the node
01092   delete tosplit;
01093 }
01094 
01095 /*****************************************************************************/
01108 /*****************************************************************************/
01109 
01110 template <typename T, int Size>
01111 void BList<T, Size>::insert_before(BNode* insertbefore, const T& value){
01112   // if the node to insert a value into is full
01113   if (full(insertbefore))
01114   {
01115     // make a copy of the node before the node to insert into
01116     BNode* prevnode = insertbefore->prev;
01117     // make a new node with value to insert into the list
01118     BNode* toinsert = new_node(value);  
01119     // link the new node to the node we tried to insert into
01120     toinsert->next = insertbefore;
01121     insertbefore->prev = toinsert;
01122     // if there is a node before the to insert into
01123     if (prevnode)
01124     { 
01125       // then link the new node to the prevnode
01126       toinsert->prev = prevnode;
01127       prevnode->next = toinsert;
01128     }
01129     // if the node we tried to insert into was the head
01130     if (insertbefore == head_)
01131       // then the new node is now the head
01132       head_ = toinsert;
01133   }
01134   // otherwise, the node to insert into is not full
01135   else
01136   {
01137     // shift values over to make room for new value at front
01138     for (int i = stats.ArraySize - 1; i > 0; --i)
01139     {
01140       insertbefore->values[i] = insertbefore->values[i - 1];
01141     }
01142     // then insert the value at the front
01143     insertbefore->values[0] = value;
01144     // increment the number of items in the node
01145     insertbefore->count++;
01146     // and number of items in the list
01147     stats.ItemCount++;
01148   }
01149 }
01150 
01151 /*****************************************************************************/
01165 /*****************************************************************************/
01166 
01167 template <typename T, int Size>
01168 typename BList<T, Size>::BNode* BList<T, Size>::copy_node(BNode* tocopy){
01169   // create a new node with value of the first element of the node to copy
01170   BNode* copy = new_node(tocopy->values[0]);
01171 
01172   // copy over all values from the node to copy, and increment counts
01173   for (int i = 1; i < tocopy->count; ++i)
01174   {
01175     copy->values[i] = tocopy->values[i];
01176     copy->count++;
01177     stats.ItemCount++;
01178   }
01179 
01180   return copy;
01181 }
01182 
01183 /*****************************************************************************/
01196 /*****************************************************************************/
01197 
01198 template <typename T, int Size>
01199 void BList<T, Size>::insert_into(BNode* insertinto, const T& value){
01200   // if the value is greater than the last element in the node to insert into
01201   if (insertinto->values[insertinto->count - 1] < value)
01202   {
01203     // then insert the value after the elements of the node
01204     insert_after(insertinto, value);
01205     // and end function
01206     return;
01207   }
01208   // if the value is less than the first element in the node to insert into
01209   if (value < insertinto->values[0])
01210   {
01211     // then insert the value before the elements of the node
01212     insert_before(insertinto, value);
01213     // and end function
01214     return;
01215   }
01216   // otherwise, the value should fit somewhere inside the node
01217   // so iterate over the elements in the node
01218   for (int i = 0; i < insertinto->count - 1; ++i)
01219   {
01220     // if the node fits in between two elements in the node
01221     if (insertinto->values[i] < value && value < insertinto->values[i+1])
01222     {
01223       // then save the position to insert the value into
01224       int pos = i + 1;
01225       // and shift over all the elements after this position
01226       for (int j = stats.ArraySize - 1; j > i; --j)
01227       {
01228         insertinto->values[j] = insertinto->values[j - 1];
01229       }
01230       // then insert the value into this element
01231       insertinto->values[pos] = value;
01232       // and increment the item counts for the list
01233       stats.ItemCount++;
01234       // and the node
01235       insertinto->count++;
01236       return;
01237     }
01238   }
01239 }
